oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Rockwell, Kiffin Yates
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: France. Army; France. Armee de l'air; France. Armee. Escadrille Lafayette

Kiffin Yates Rockwell was one of the founding pilots in the squadron known as the Escadrille Americaine (later named the Lafayette Escadrille) and was the first American pilot to down an enemy plane. He was the recipient of multiple military awards. The Buncombe County Committee of Colonial Dames paid for ambulance to be inscribed with his name and sent to the Western front. North Carolina has given him a cabinet in the Hall of History in Raleigh.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Tennessee World War I Gold Star Records, 1918-1924 (RG 53)
